question: In mice, does deleting Sirt1 specifically in SF1 (steroidogenic factor 1) neurons confer resistance to diet-induced obesity and prevent insulin resistance? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here, we show that mice lacking SIRT1 in steroidogenic factor 1 (SF1) neurons are hypersensitive to dietary obesity owing to maladaptive energy expenditure.
content.source_2: In high-fat–fed cohorts, mutant mice showed reduced susceptibility to diet-induced type 2 diabetes, exhibiting improved skeletal muscle insulin sensitivity in hyperinsulinemic–euglycemic clamp assays.
content.source_3: Rather than overexpression, deletion of SIRT1 in SF1 neurons conferred resistance to diet-induced obesity and insulin resistance, coinciding with elevated energy expenditure and enhanced muscle insulin action.
